meanings.definition: To fasten or stick onto something
meanings.sent1: She affixed the stamp to the envelope.
meanings.sent2: He always affixed his signature at the bottom of the document.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel affixed the acorn to the tree with great care.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood are affixed in my mind like photographs on a wall.
meanings.sent5: The teacher affixed the gold star to the student's work as a reward.

meanings.definition: To attach or join to something
meanings.sent1: The artist affixed the painting to the wall with nails.
meanings.sent2: Please affix the label to the package before sending it out.
meanings.sent3: The cat affixed its gaze on the bird outside the window.
meanings.sent4: Her smile affixed a sense of warmth to the room.
meanings.sent5: The glue affixed the broken pieces back together seamlessly.

meanings.definition: To add as a supplement or appendix
meanings.sent1: He affixed a note to the end of the report for further clarification.
meanings.sent2: The author affixed footnotes to the book for additional information.
meanings.sent3: The chef affixed a special recipe to the menu for the day.
meanings.sent4: The new law affixed more regulations to the existing ones.
meanings.sent5: She affixed a postscript to the letter with a heartfelt message.
